_header: As reason ruled my reckless mind
_description: ‘Filius regis mortuus est’, the lament of the Virgin Mary — twelve 12-line stanzas

BodDou78.First Lines:
As Reson Rywlyde my Rechyles myndeby wayes & wyldernes as y
                    hadde wente…
BodDou78.Last Lines:
…þou schalte se þi swete son and sayffilius
                        Regis is a lyve et non mortuus est
BodDou78.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 8-13.

BodRawC86.First Lines:
As Ihesu rewlith myn reccheles myndeBe A wode wylde therby as I
                    went…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…heuyn blisse shalbe ȝour solaceThat filius Regis
                        mortuus est

BLHar3954.First Lines: as reson hathe rulyd my recles myndeBe a wey wandryng as I went…
BLHar3954.Last Lines: …þe fende of mankende had gret trystThere lost he his cause þat lekid hym illeWhan filius regis mortuus est
BLHar3954.Attributed Title: Explicit ffilius Regis (below last line, f. 91v)
BLHar3954.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 3954.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_3954.
BLHar3954.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 233-42.

Lam853.First Lines:
As resoun rewlid my richelees myndeBi wielde waies as y hadd
                    wentA solempne citee me fortuned to fyndeTo turne þerto was myne
                    entent…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…If ony man loue me leue me a plaseWhere y may wepe my fille
                    & resteAnd my sone wole graunte him sum þat he hasffilius
                    regis mortuus est
Lam853.Note:
Written as prose. Quire [6] is bound before Quire [5], which page
                    numbering takes into account.
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 233-42.
